fields.descriptive_line: 'You Can't Lay Down Your Memories' chest of drawers, designed by Tejo Remy, 1991, manufactured for Droog Design, after 1993
fields.physical_description:
Twenty found / reclaimed twentieth century, drawers and one wine rack, each in an individually fitted maple housing, the whole group strapped together with a length of industrial hemp strapping.
[Drawer] Dark stained and lacquered drawer, late 20c, metal handle
[Drawer] Wooden drawer, mid 20c, veneered front, brass handle, brass label holder.
[Drawer] Wooden drawer, mid-20c, three internal divisions, front painted beige, black plastic handle
[Drawer] Wooden drawer, late-20c, carved zig-zag decoration on front, carved wooden knob
[Drawer] Wooden drawer, 20c, paint-splattered within and without. Metal handle
[Drawer] Wooden drawer, 20c, front painted grey with applied decals of tools, black plastic handle
[Drawer] Wooden drawer for card files, 20c, front and wooden handle painted cream, black pen 'ROOD' on drawer front and '9' on top edge
[Wine rack] Wooden wine rack comprising of two lattices of wooden lengths held apart by wooden spacers
[Drawer] Wooden drawer from a sideboard, 20c, five compartments for cutlery, green flocked lining, oak front, brass handle
[Drawer] Wooden drawer, 20c, dark stained drawer front with wooden rod handle on two white plastic brackets and an aluminium knob handle
[Drawer] Wooden drawer with wooden handle, 20c
[Drawer] Metal drawer, 20c, painted cream, red painted metal handle
[Drawer] Wooden drawer, 20c, two wooden knob handles, possibly from the same piece of furniture as W.39:20/2-2008
[Drawer] White plastic drawer from a refrigerator, late 20c, blue horizontal line across the front and the word HYDRATOR
[Drawer] Drawer, late-20c, made of particle board with plastic laminate surface, white interior, dark wood effect drawer front, aluminium handle
[Drawer] Wooden drawer, 20c, three interior compartments, black metal ring pull handle
[Drawer] Metal drawer, 20c, probably from a desk, beige interior black front
[Drawer] Translucent moulded polypropylene drawer, late-20c, integral handle
[Drawer] Wooden drawer, 20c, softwood, wooden knob handle, possibly from the same piece of furniture as W.39:14/2-2008
[Drawer] Drawer, late-20c, probably from bedroom furniture, particle board with plastic laminate surface, raised 'rococo' moulding on over-painted white wooden front, two brass knob handles
[Drawer] Metal desk drawer, late 20c, grey metal interior, wooden strip handle, torn dark red laminated surface to drawer front

fields.public_access_description: This remarkable reconfiguration of a chest of drawers was one of the most startling and influential furniture designs of the 1990s. Each drawer was salvaged from an existing piece of furniture, most commonly from office systems or cheap domestic furniture. In themselves they are unremarkable, but the drawers have been made precious by re-housing them in specially constructed solid maple housings, often of far greater quality than the drawers themselves. The design encourages us to reconsider questions of value, and to think about the histories of the furniture from which the drawers came, and the lives of the people who used them.  This re-connection with history, and the 'make-do-and-mend' aesthetic of the industrial strap binding the drawers together, were typical of Dutch design of the period, and ran counter to the slick modernity and minimalism of much contemporary design. Two years after it was designed the chest of drawers was included in the first collection by Droog Design, the group that did most to popularise Dutch conceptual design ideas outside the Netherlands.
fields.bibliography:
Paola Antonelli, 'Objects of Design from the Museum of Modern Art', MoMA, New York, 2003, p.276
Gareth Williams, 'The Furniture Machine, furniture since 1990', V&A, 2006, p.32
